item.title: Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 launches in 2025 for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Fight your way through the events of the Entertainment District, Swordsmith Village and Hashira Training arcs.

Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2025, publishers Aniplex and SEGA, and developer CyberConnect2 announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via SEGA:

About

Forge bonds, slay demons!

Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles 2 is coming in 2025!

Hashira Joins as Playable Characters

All nine Hashira, the highest-ranking Demon-Slayer swordmen: Giyu Tomioka (Water Hashira), Kyojuro Rengoku (Flame Hashira), Tengen Uzui (Sound Hashira), Muichiro Tokito (Mist Hashira), Shinobu Kocho (Insect Hashira), Mitsuri Kanroji (Love Hashira), Obanai Iguro (Serpent Hashira), Sanemi Shinazugawa (Wind Hashira), and Gyomei Himejima (Stone Hashira) have been made into playable characters.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Story Mode

Continue where Tanjiro’s journey left off in the first Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles.

Fight your way through the events of the Entertainment District Arc, Swordsmith Village Arc, and Hashira Training Arc from the anime adaptation!

VS Mode

Select from a wide array of brand-new characters to play as, such as Muichiro Tokito and Mitsuri Kanroji, the two Hashira who take on an Upper Rank demon in the Swordsmith Village Arc. The full roster includes the eighteen characters from the original Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Hinokami Chronicles, the demons added in the free update, and the characters from the Entertainment District downloadable content packs.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery. Visit the official website here: English / Japanese.

item.title: Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero post-launch DLC schedule announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/phantom-brave-the-lost-hero-post-launch-dlc-schedule-announced

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Six scenarios, eight playable characters, and five handy adventuring items.

Nippon Ich Software has announced the post-launch downloadable content schedule for strategy Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero, which includes six additional scenarios and eight playable characters from previous Nippon Ichi Software games.

Get the details below.

■ Season Pass (4,900 yen / 5,390 yen with tax)

A bundle including all six additional scenarios and eight playable characters characters, as well as the five handy adventuring items. As a bonus, users who purchase the Season Pass will also receive the bonus downloadable content “Grunt Pirate Costume” for the Sailor, Healer, and Chef general character classes.

■ Scenarios and Characters

February 6, 2025

  • Scenario: “Siblings from Parallel Worlds”
    • Characters: Castile and Walnut (Phantom Brave)
    • Price: 1,400 yen (1,540 yen with tax)

February 13, 2025

  • Scenario: “Heroes of the Past”
    • Characters: Scarlet and Sprout (Phantom Brave)
    • Price: 1,400 yen (1,540 yen with tax)

February 20, 2025

  • Scenario: “The Pirate and the Wanderer“
    • Characters: Samayoi, the Wanderer (Bar Stella Abyss)
    • Price: 700 yen (770 yen with tax)
  • Scenario: “The Liar Princess and the Lost Prince”
    • Characters: Princess (The Liar Princess and the Blind Prince)
    • Price: 700 yen (770 yen with tax)

February 27, 2025

  • Scenario: “The Girl Who Summoned a Ghost”
    • Characters: Kotomo (Yomawari)
    • Price: 700 yen (770 yen with tax)
  • Scenario: “The Rat Feared by the Devil”
    • Characters: Mad Rat & Heart (Mad Rat Dead)
    • Price: 700 yen (770 yen with tax)

■ Handy Adventuring Items

January 30, 2025

  • BOL Sack (100 yen / 110 yen with tax) – Grants 100,000 BOL (in-game currency).
  • Mana Sack (100 yen / 110 yen with tax) – Grants 50,000 mana to use when upgrading items.
  • Boost Ticket 100% (100 yen / 110 yen with tax) – A ticket that increases BOL, mana, and EXP earned in battle by 100 percent.
  • Boost Ticket 400% (100 yen / 110 yen with tax) – A ticket that increases BOL, mana, and EXP earned in battle by 400 percent.
  • Boost Ticket 900% (100 yen / 110 yen with tax) – A ticket that increases BOL, mana, and EXP earned in battle by 900 percent.

Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on January 30, 2025 worldwide, followed by PC via Steam in spring 2025.
